title: Ticket #378: Submitting a shell script from Windows to a *nix machine does not work
description:
When using the job wrapper, like we do on the CS pool, submitting a shell script from Windows to a *nix machine does not work. It results in an access denied error: 

  > more hostname.sh
  #!/bin/sh
  hostname


  > more hostname.5.0.err.txt
  /unsup/condor/etc/cs_cluster_job_wrapper: line 74: /scratch/condor/execute/dir_32692/condor_exec.exe: Permission denied
  /unsup/condor/etc/cs_cluster_job_wrapper: line 74: exec: /scratch/condor/execute/dir_32692/condor_exec.exe: cannot execute: Permission denied

This has only been tested, to my knowledge, on Linux execute nodes. And is not specific to our pool. (Nate has the RUST ticket number.)
remarks:
